channel.title: KenSmith tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from KenSmith.

item.description: As the story goes, a family friend, when she was maybe ten, saw Fr. Hesburgh on the @NotreDame campus, approached him and said, “Father, thank you for making Notre Dame co-ed,” and he replied, “Somebody had to do it. It was like a locker room around this place.”
@davewiner I’m guessing you gather information for three rows, then solve.
“A book must be the axe for the frozen sea within us. That is my belief.” Franz Kafka https://t.co/uDGsxOAaY8
Adding more and more guns . . . A piece by @SkinnerPm. https://t.co/g2D6Oec5Ye https://t.co/A4fugasafE
The pond is all lawyered up. https://t.co/UVPsrlPljS

Wordle 349 3/6 ⬛🟨⬛🟨⬛ 🟨🟨🟩⬛🟩 🟩🟩🟩🟩🟩 1. First word has five of the top nine letters for frequency in English: etaonrish. 2. If that yields two yellows, second word should move those letters and include another three from the top nine.

Got elected to public office? Need a form letter to give voters the feeling that their voices might matter but maybe not? Rip off the bones of this model and start a-mailing . . . https://t.co/7m2nncWApJ

Wordle 349 3/6 ⬛🟨⬛🟨⬛ 🟨🟨🟩⬛🟩 🟩🟩🟩🟩🟩 1. First word has five of the top nine letters for frequency in English: etaonrish. 2. If that yields two yellows, second word should move those letters and include three further from the top nine.
Inside the city limits here. https://t.co/fWYohlgruw

"If you look at people with a detached, emotionless gaze, it doesn’t really matter what your beliefs are, because you have morally disengaged. You have perceived a person not as a full human but as a thing . . ." https://t.co/lcaN7j9bGM

If you rent enough rooms, a venue puts your name up in lights. In Orlando, we all walked into a wide dining room. One long wall was a kelpy aquarium where Disney scuba divers held “Welcome AGLSP” signs, finny beings swam by on all levels, and bubbles wobbled up and out of sight.
"Saving the web and saving democracy are related projects." https://t.co/uwW8bIX7nl https://t.co/sAMjHuUWox
Homework on one side of a postcard. https://t.co/MILeVkigeO
@byheckbepeace Is there a good link to her work?
Another day of silence from @RepWalorski, @SenatorBraun, and @SenToddYoung on gun violence. They’ve got nothing to offer.
Wordsworth and the shepherd. https://t.co/MoEcN5ea2R https://t.co/64UwBf2stq

Since mass shooters often leave torturous manifestos or computers filled with wretched political content related to the shooting, it is not the politician speaking later that politicizes the shooting. It is already political.
Since the access to weapons is shaped by public policy and political action over many years, it is not the politician speaking later that politicizes the mass shooting. It is already political.
Since victims of a mass shooting were entitled to their lives and liberty, which are rights won through political struggle, it is not the politician speaking later that politicizes the mass shooting. It is already political.
“Human civilization is based on the assumption of a stable climate.” https://t.co/j05ddiuwmp
"The Death of Captain Waskow" by Ernie Pyle. https://t.co/5jpkzXwciO
Writers don't always know how the work is going. Ernie Pyle thought he was losing his touch, but everyone who read the new column fought back the tears. https://t.co/Hrb5WELp0m

“The roar of his motor reached a peak of sound as he swept by, an upleasant rough-throated gargle rising to a shout—and then he was near the end of the deck, his wheels lifting a thin distance off the boards, then sweeping off over the blue water.” https://t.co/vKD8GRphoJ
Painters don’t worry too much about symmetry. #2 https://t.co/E9gdz3iNYi
Painters don’t worry too much about symmetry. #1 https://t.co/vYgXb3fo96
So much for living a merely private life. https://t.co/SwAvZ77hDR

Will a Republican respond to pressure and change? Not readily. But people ridiculed their empty “thoughts and prayers” tweets so hard that those are rare now. In recent tweets, new phrases serve a similar function. So it is possible to get a Republican to use different words.
